agent_utterance: Tonight, prepare one pre-portioned, protein-rich snack option you actually like (for example, a small yogurt cup with berries, a handful of nuts, or a string cheese) and keep it within easy reach. When evening stress or a craving hits, take a 60-second pause, then choose that snack first before reaching for other foods. This simple, predictable step supports your structure-driven goals and builds small, steady progress toward healthier eating.

agent_utterance: Tonight, after your 60-second pause, do a quick hunger check on a 1–5 scale. If you’re at 3 or higher, choose your pre-portioned yogurt with berries and eat it mindfully. If you’re at 1–2, wait 10 minutes, then re-check—if hunger remains, use your snack as planned; otherwise, sip water or take a brief, relaxing activity. This keeps your step small and structured while nudging toward steadier eating.

This aligns with their goal of gradual progress toward the target behavior level while leveraging an anchor snack.
